clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Clincial Trial to Evaluate the Effects of an Internett-based Support System for Cancer Patients on Symptom Distress, Depression, and Quality of Life.

arm_group.description: Patients had access to the Internet support system WebChoice that allowed them to monitor symptoms over time, and provided access to evidence-based self-management options tailored to their reported symptoms as well as to a communication area where patients could ask questions to a clinical nurse specialist in cancer care and exchange experiences with other cancer patients.
The control group receiving usual care

intervention.description: Patients in the experimental group had over the study period access to the Internet support system WebChoice that allowed them to monitor symptoms over time, and provided access to evidence-based self-management options tailored to their reported symptoms as well as a communication area where patients could ask questions to a clinical nurse specialist in cancer care and exchange experiences with other cancer patients. Patients in the control group received usual care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Above 18 years
- Starting or currently undergoing treatment for breast or prostate cancer
- Internet access at home
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who had received radiation on the brain as this may have affected their abilities to reliably report their symptoms.
